title: Methionine
summary: Methionine (symbol Met or M)[3] (/mɪˈθaɪəniːn/)[4] is an essential amino acid in humans. As the substrate for other amino acids such as cysteine and taurine, versatile compounds such as SAM-e, and the important antioxidant glutathione, methionine plays a critical role in the metabolism and health of many species, including humans. It is encoded by the codon AUG.
